data.title: Direct Line appoints corporate affairs director
data.meta_description: Direct Line appoints corporate affairs director. From PR Week
data.text:
Roger Lowry (pictured) joins Direct Line Group from another insurance firm, QBE Insurance, where he served as international director of communications and marketing.

He brings a wealth of financial services and regulatory experience to the role of director of corporate affairs, having also held senior comms roles at the Royal Bank of Scotland and Ofcom.

Lowry’s new role is intended to strengthen Direct Line Group’s external and internal communications.

He will report directly to chief executive Adam Winslow and attend the executive committee.

Commenting on his appointment, Lowry said: “I’m delighted to be joining an organisation with the underlying strength of Direct Line Group. I look forward to communicating our new corporate narrative to the market and reinvigorating our public affairs engagement.”

Other new appointments at the business include Hugh Hessing as chief operating officer, Alexandra Hayes as chief of staff to the chief executive; Craig Thornton as managing director of home and growth; and Martin Milliner as managing director of claims.

Winslow said: “At our full year results, I committed to strengthening our leadership team to deliver the changes that are required. The new appointments I’m announcing today will be central to delivering our strategy to transform the Group.

“The calibre of these appointments is a testament to the underlying strength and attractiveness of the business. The experience and expertise of these leaders will make a significant difference, not only in the areas they oversee, but also at ExCo, where they will provide strategic leadership and drive to shape the future of our organisation.”
